channel.title: Encrypting Scripts?
channel.description:
Un-Named just showed me an auth system, but i've noticed that omeone could get the script, and remove the auth.
Is there any way to encrypt your scripts? like, make them read: %25%18%17%16%20%15%15%14 instead of if(findbitmap.. or it there a way to make the script ONLY RUN if it has the auth? Like, another include or somthing?
Thanks, Deathader

item.title: Encrypting Scripts?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

There was a way to decrypt them, and it was very very easy.

Well, get to them after they were decrypted rather than decrypt them yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: Encrypting Scripts?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“bbri06, post:9, topic:48851”]Go here, whats that all about?

http://www.kaitnieks.com/files/getcert.php[/quote]

Before while Kaitnieks was alive Kaitnieks/Dylocks would encrypt scripts, there was no way to decrypt them. I’m not sure if either of them would beable to do it but I wouldn’t use it.

Read full topic

item.title: Encrypting Scripts?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

There is support for encrypted scripts in SCAR. Good luck figuring out how to do it though.

Read full topic

item.title: Encrypting Scripts?
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

I am not sure but I belive you open it, type the location of the script you want to ob. then hit enter and it works. Not sure though.

Also, stick anti randoms + an important function if you use the pluggin method.

Read full topic

item.title: Encrypting Scripts?
item.dc:creator: @deathader deathader
item.description:
@deathader wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:2, topic:48851”]there is Obfuscation, which is when you replace the names of stuff, its the best we’ve to so far

you could be like jagex and spend ages coding traps into your script

a Scar Obfuscator can be found on impsoft forums[/quote]

Ok, I got the program, now, how do I use it?

Read full topic

item.title: Encrypting Scripts?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Stick an important function in a plugin and put the auth stuff in the plugin. A bit more of a pain in the ass for your users, but much harder to reverse a dll than a script.

Read full topic

item.title: Encrypting Scripts?

item.description:

there is Obfuscation, which is when you replace the names of stuff, its the best we’ve to so far

you could be like jagex and spend ages coding traps into your script

a Scar Obfuscator can be found on impsoft forums

Read full topic
